children.subject:
Things can change, but I actually believe the plan right now is to have the lectures on edge.edX so you can view them remotely. You won’t have to show up to a lecture screening. 


I believe they will be specially re-recorded for this iteration of the course.

I respect and see the logic behind that.

I think it would also be great to have lecture for those who want to learn that way(Somewhat of an expectation to have traditional lectures in a non-online course), and simply webcast and provide those pre-recorded videos if you choose to make them? Josh Hug did this for 61B.

I could be wrong, but it seems like 186 is intended to be moved into an online course, and this is the pilot for that.

I personally was super excited to sit front row and learn from an amazing professor like Hellerstein. I understand that videos in some ways provide more value, but the same could be said for lectures.
Where will these sessions be shown? Multiple rooms? Will the lectures be recorded this semester, or will we watch lectures from past semesters?

I just enrolled in the course, but it is not showing up on my calcentral. It says it was approved and if i re-try to add the class there is no "select" option which makes me think I did enroll, but I don't understand why its not present
Low lecture attendance, in a nutshell. It’s a new format

Wait I want 3 hours of lecture straight in same place every TTh please keep in person lectures!

Do it for The Rock. Do it for the people.
Why is 186 being taught this way? Has this happened in the past?
Should we expect the "new format" would extend till the spring semester?

Hi all, 

I'm afraid staff advisers are unable to answer your questions about future plans, course structure, and pedagogy, this is decided by the faculty. I don't believe the CS 186 faculty are on this piazza page. 


Best wishes,

Nicole

history.content:
Hi All,

In F18, the instructor will not regularly give live lectures. Instead, GSIs (and occasionally the instructor) will facilitate session and show pre-recorded lecture.

               At this time, I'm not sure if the lecture will be made available later as a webcast. I am checking with the professor now and will post an update when I know.

Discussion sections will be the same as previous semesters.

For enrollment, please note: You need to enroll into the lecture and the 999 discussion section only. Assignments to actual discussion sections will be handled outside of CalCentral just prior to the start of class or during the first lecture.
history.subject: F18: New Format for CS 186 Lecture - Read before you enroll!
